summary.para: Represents the method that handles the E:System.AppDomain.TypeResolve, E:System.AppDomain.ResourceResolve, and E:System.AppDomain.AssemblyResolve events of an T:System.AppDomain.

content.para: A T:System.ResolveEventArgs that contains the event data.

returnValue.para: The T:System.Reflection.Assembly that resolves the type, assembly, or resource.

content.para: If the runtime class loader cannot resolve a reference to an assembly, type, or resource, then the corresponding events are raised to give the callback a chance to tell the runtime which assembly the referenced assembly, type, or resource is in. It is the responsibility of the T:System.ResolveEventHandler to return the assembly that resolves the type, assembly, or resource.
Every derived class of T:System.Delegate and T:System.MulticastDelegate has a constructor and an Invoke method. See the C++ code example in the description for the T:System.Delegate class.
